name: Kevin Porter Jr.
blurb: The lefty was named MVP of the Metro League after averaging 28 points and 12 rebounds per game. He’ll play college ball at USC.

name: C.J. Elleby
blurb: He’s already had his No. 2 jersey retired and is the Eagles’ all-time leader in points (1,500) and rebounds (1,043). The Metro League first-team pick is headed to play at Washington State.

name: J'Raan Brooks
blurb: The Metro League’s co-Defensive Player of the Year averaged 13.4 points and 11.3 rebounds per game. A four-star recruit, Brooks is undecided between multiple Division I offers.

name: P.J. Fuller
blurb: The first-team all-Metro League selection is also a four-star recruit with a clutch outside shot. He averaged 17.7 points, 6.8 rebounds, 5 assists and 3.2 steals per game this regular-season.

name: Jaden McDaniels
blurb: The co-MVP of the NPSL Olympic Division averaged 21.3 points, 10.0 rebounds and 4.6 blocks per game for the Eagles, who went 20-0 in the regular season.

name: Brandon Roy
blurb: A two-time Star Times pick as a player, Roy led his alma mater to an undefeated regular-season and the Metro League title after going 29-0 with Nathan Hale last year with a Class 3A state title (and didn't show up for pictures like everybody else).

name: Kylee Griffen
blurb: The WesCo 4A MVP played multiple positions, but she will play guard for Gonzaga this fall. She averaged 21.5 points and 10.0 rebounds per game her senior season, topping 1,300 points for her career.

name: Jordyn Jenkins
blurb: She lead the defending Class 4A state champs to league and district titles. The all-NSPL Casacde Division first-team pick averaged 17.0 points and 7.1 rebounds.

name: Dalayah Daniels
blurb: The Metro League MVP averaged 15.1 points and 10.9 rebounds per game in her first season starting for the Bulldogs.

name: Gina Marxen
blurb: The two-time MVP of KingCo 4A ran the offense, averaging 6.5 assists in a 19-1 regular-season. The Idaho commit was a four-year varsity starter.

name: Grace Sarver
blurb: One of the fiercest defenders in the Metro League, Sarver averaged 13.0 points, 6.0 rebounds, and 3.0 steals. The first-team pick helped the Wildcats win the SeaKing District championship.

name: Sara Goldie
blurb: Goldie coached her alma mater to its best regular-season finish in school history at 19-1. The Wolves held opponents to 29.7 percent shooting from the field and forced an averaged 17.1 turnovers.
